class vizasm.model.objc.arguments.Arguments.Arguments(name, arguments, is_static)[source]¶

Bases: vizasm.model.objc.object.nsobject.NSObject.NSObject, vizasm.analysis.asm.cpu.Resetable.Resetable

Superclass for a class with arguments that can be filled from the cpu (register or stack)

Parameters :

arguments: list<object> :

queue holding selector arguments

Notes

cnt_needs_arguments cnt_has_arguments

Methods

add_argument(argument) Add an argument to the object.
clear_arguments() Reset the arguments
cnt_has_arguments() Return the number of arguments currently available
cnt_missing_arguments() Return the number of missing arguments
cnt_needs_arguments() Return the number of arguments needed
create_msg_send(selector, *args, **kwargs) Create a MsgSend with the specified selector.
fill_from_cpu(cpu, register_list) Fill as much arguments as possible from cpu (registers and stack).
get_arguments()
get_is_static()
get_nsobject()
get_obj_name()
get_objc_name()
get_retain_count()
needs_more_arguments() Return if more arguments are needed
release() Release object – decrement retain count
reset() Reset the Arguments by clearing its arguments
retain() Retain object – increment retain count
set_arguments(value)
set_is_static(value)
set_obj_name(value)
set_objc_name(value)
try_add_arguments(arg_list) Try to add the arguments.
add_argument(argument)[source]¶

Add an argument to the object. Subclasses should raise their own Exception if the arguments are overloaded.

Raises :

ArgumentsOverloadedException :

if the class has more arguments than it needs

RuntimeError :

if a subclass of Arguments is already in the arguments.
arguments¶

arguments(list<object>) – queue holding selector arguments

clear_arguments()[source]¶

Reset the arguments

cnt_has_arguments()[source]¶

Return the number of arguments currently available

cnt_missing_arguments()[source]¶

Return the number of missing arguments

cnt_needs_arguments()[source]¶

Return the number of arguments needed

fill_from_cpu(cpu, register_list)[source]¶

Fill as much arguments as possible from cpu (registers and stack).

Parameters :

register_list: list<Register> :

the list of registers from which to fill
Raises :

ArgumentsUnderloadedException :

raised if more arguments than needed came from the cpu

ArgumentsOverloadedException :

raised if not enough arguments came from the cpu
get_arguments()[source]¶
needs_more_arguments()[source]¶

Return if more arguments are needed

reset()[source]¶

Reset the Arguments by clearing its arguments

set_arguments(value)[source]¶
try_add_arguments(arg_list)[source]¶

Try to add the arguments. Trying means not to raise any exception if the operation fails.

the format string

add_argument(argument)[source]¶

Add an argument to the FormatString

Raises :

FormatStringOverLoadedException :

if FormatString has more arguments than it needs
cnt_has_arguments()[source]¶

Return the number of arguments the FormatString already has

cnt_needs_arguments()[source]¶

Return the number of arguments the FormatString needs

fill_from_cpu(cpu, register_list=None)[source]¶

Fill the arguments of the selector from cpu (registers and stack)

Parameters :

register_list :

the list of register from which to fill (if None is passed, the default register list is used)
Raises :

FormatStringOverLoadedException :

raised if more arguments than needed came from the cpu

FormatStringUnderLoadedException :

raised if not enough arguments came from the cpu
format_string¶

format_string – the format string (mapped to value from Value)

class vizasm.model.objc.arguments.Selector.Selector(name, arguments=None, is_static=False)[source]¶

Bases: vizasm.model.objc.arguments.Arguments.Arguments, vizasm.model.objc.AsmParserInterface.AsmParserInterface, vizasm.hopper.HopperAnnotationInterface.HopperAnnotationInterface

Represents an objective-c selector

Parameters :

selector_name: string :

the name of the selector (mapped to objc_name)

Methods

add_argument(argument) Add an argument to the selector
clear_arguments() Reset the arguments
cnt_has_arguments() Return the number of arguments the selector has.
cnt_missing_arguments() Return the number of missing arguments
cnt_needs_arguments() return the number of arguments the selector takes indicated by the number of ”:” in the selector name
create_from_asm_line(asmline) Create Selector from asm line like e.g. @selector(objectForKey:)
create_msg_send(selector, *args, **kwargs) Create a MsgSend with the specified selector.
does_release() Return if the selector decrements the retain count
does_retain() Return if the selector increments the retain count
fill_from_cpu(cpu[, register_list]) Fill the arguments of the selector from cpu (registers and stack)
get_argument_at_idx(idx) Return the argument at specified idx.
get_argument_for_sub_selector(subsel_name) Get the argument for the sub selector.
get_arguments()
get_is_static()
get_nsobject()
get_obj_name()
get_objc_name()
get_retain_count()
get_selector_name()
hopper_str()
is_alloc() Return if the selectorname is alloc
is_autorelease() Return if the selectorname is autorelease
is_init() Return if the selectorname is init
is_kind_of_init() Return if the selectorname begins with init
is_new() Return if the selectorname is new
is_release() Return if the selectorname is release
is_retain() Return if the selectorname is retain
is_retain_count_important() Return if the selector has an impact on the retain count
needs_more_arguments() Return if more arguments are needed
release() Release object – decrement retain count
reset() Reset the Arguments by clearing its arguments
retain() Retain object – increment retain count
selector_from_delimiter(selectorname[, ...]) Return a Selector from a string like e.g. get_arg1_arg2_ where “_” is the delimiter
selector_from_underscore_delimiter(selectorname) Return a Selector from a string like e.g. get_arg1_arg2_ where “_” is the delimiter
set_argument_for_sub_selector(subsel_name, ...) Set the argument for the sub selector.
set_arguments(value)
set_is_static(value)
set_obj_name(value)
set_objc_name(value)
set_selector_name(selname)
sub_selectors() Get a list of sub selector names
try_add_arguments(arg_list) Try to add the arguments.
try_get_hopper_string(obj) Use the hopper_str() representation if available.
SELECTOR_ALLOC = 'alloc'¶
SELECTOR_AUTORELEASE = 'autorelease'¶
SELECTOR_DELIMITER = ':'¶
SELECTOR_INIT = 'init'¶
SELECTOR_NEW = 'new'¶
SELECTOR_RELEASE = 'release'¶
SELECTOR_RETAIN = 'retain'¶
add_argument(argument)[source]¶

Add an argument to the selector

Raises :

SelectorOverloadedException :

if selector has more arguments than it needs
cnt_has_arguments()[source]¶

Return the number of arguments the selector has. This is not the number of arguments the selector really (see cnt_needs_arguments()) needs!

cnt_needs_arguments()[source]¶

return the number of arguments the selector takes indicated by the number of ”:” in the selector name

static create_from_asm_line(asmline)[source]¶

Create Selector from asm line like e.g. @selector(objectForKey:)

does_release()[source]¶

Return if the selector decrements the retain count

does_retain()[source]¶

Return if the selector increments the retain count

fill_from_cpu(cpu, register_list=None)[source]¶

Fill the arguments of the selector from cpu (registers and stack)

Parameters :

register_list :

the list of register from which to fill (if None is passed, the default register list is used Cpu.selector_arg_registers())
Raises :

SelectorUnderloadedException :

raised if more arguments than needed came from the cpu

SelectorOverloadedException :

raised if not enough arguments came from the cpu
get_argument_at_idx(idx)[source]¶

Return the argument at specified idx. If not found None will be returned

get_argument_for_sub_selector(subsel_name)[source]¶

Get the argument for the sub selector.

Parameters :

subsel_name: string :

name of the sub selector

Return if the selectorname is new

Return if the selectorname is release

is_retain()[source]¶

Return if the selectorname is retain

Return if the selector has an impact on the retain count

static selector_from_delimiter(selectorname, delimiter='_')[source]¶

Return a Selector from a string like e.g. get_arg1_arg2_ where “_” is the delimiter

Parameters :

selectorname: string :

selectorname like get_arg1_arg2_

delimiter: string, optional :

delimits the selector (default is “_”)
static selector_from_underscore_delimiter(selectorname)[source]¶

Return a Selector from a string like e.g. get_arg1_arg2_ where “_” is the delimiter

selector_name¶

selector_name – the name of the selector (mapped to objc_name)

Bases: vizasm.model.objc.arguments.ArgumentsOverloadedException.ArgumentsOverloadedException
